alert.note: Alert for Southeast Fayette; Southeast Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Raleigh and southeastern Fayette Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Babcock State Park, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Piney View and Meadow Bridge. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 133 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
